tool.name: aurora_htseq

regex.description: Check the warnings_and_errors.txt file for more details.

tool.command:
######### each aurora tool generates a html file and have an files path directory associated with it. mkdir -p $report.files_path &&
######### three important paths: ######### 1. path to tool installation directory ######### 2. path to report html ######### 3. path to files_path directory associated with the report output. export TOOL_INSTALL_DIR='${__tool_directory__}' && export REPORT='$report' && export REPORT_FILES_PATH='$report.files_path' &&
############ create a hidden file to store r markdown rendering log echo '------ Rmd rendering log -------\n' > $report.files_path/.r_rendering.log.txt &&
Rscript '${__tool_directory__}/htseq_count_render.R'
-o $report -d $report.files_path
-A '$alignment_files' -B '$sample_names' -G $gff -f $format -r $order -S $stranded -a $minaqual -T $feature_type -i $idattr -m $mode -c $count -O $count_rdata

param.name: sample_names
param.label: Sample names
param.help: sample names for each input SAM/BAM file. Use comma to separate multiple names, for example, sample_1, sample_2, sample_3. The number of sample names should be the same as the number of input SAM/BAM files.

param.name: order
param.label: Order
param.help: Use this option to indicate how the input data has been sorted. The default is name.

param.name: minaqual
param.label: Alignment quality
param.help: Skip all reads with alignment quality lower than the given minimum value (default: 10)

param.name: feature_type
param.label: Feature type
param.help: Feature type (3rd column in GFF file) to be used, all features of other type are ignored (default, suitable for RNA-Seq analysis using an Ensembl GTF file: exon)

param.name: idattr
param.label: ID attribute
param.help: GFF attribute to be used as feature ID. Several GFF lines with the same feature ID will be considered as parts of the same feature. The feature ID is used to identity the counts in the output table. The default, suitable for RNA-Seq analysis using an Ensembl GTF file, is gene_id.

param.name: mode
param.label: Mode
param.help: Mode to handle reads overlapping more than one feature. Possible values for <mode> are union, intersection-strict and intersection-nonempty (default: union)
